docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court was definitive in its decision to legalize gay marriage nationwide, but what is far from clear is whether U.S. companies must offer corporate benefits to same-sex spouses.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Ruling Leaves U.S. Firms Unclear on Spousal Benefits

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth continued to juice up its business outside health insurance in a better-than-expected second quarter while rivals scrambled to add enrollment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dispensaries for expensive drugs that treat complex or rare diseases are surging, but their customer service and business practices are under scrutiny.

headline.main: Specialty Pharmacies Proliferate, Along With Questions
headline.print_headline: When Getting a Refill Is a Battle

docs.abstract: So-called specialty pharmacies, which dispense complex and costly drugs to battle rare diseases, are rising fast, but patients have mixed experiences; specialty medications account for one-third of drug spending in United States, up from 19 percent in 2004; industry had estimated sales of $78 billion in 2014.
docs.snippet: Dispensaries for expensive drugs that treat complex or rare diseases are surging, but their customer service and business practices are under scrutiny.

byline.contributor: Katie Thomas reported from Sinking Spring, Pa., and Andrew Pollack from Los Angeles.
byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and ANDREW POLLACK

docs.lead_paragraph: Marilyn B. Tavenner, who was criticized for the troubled rollout of the HealthCare.Gov website, will succeed Karen M. Ignagni as the insurance industry’s top lobbyist.

headline.main: Head of Obama’s Health Care Rollout to Lobby for Insurers
headline.print_headline: Head of Obama’s Health Care Rollout to Lobby for Insurers

docs.abstract: Marilyn B Tavenner, former Obama administration official in charge of HealthCare.gov rollout, is appointed president and chief executive of trade group America’s Health Insurance Plans; move makes Tavenner top lobbyist for nation's health insurance industry.
docs.snippet: Marilyn B. Tavenner, who was criticized for the troubled rollout of the HealthCare.Gov website, will succeed Karen M. Ignagni as the insurance industry’s top lobbyist.

docs.lead_paragraph: Phony applicants that investigators signed up last year under President Barack Obama's health care law got automatically re-enrolled for 2015. Some were rewarded with even bigger taxpayer subsidies for their insurance premiums, a congressional probe has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in Denver on Tuesday ruled that an order of Roman Catholic nuns must comply with President Barack Obama's healthcare law requiring employers to provide insurance that covers contraception.

headline.main: Federal Appeals Court Rules Against Nuns in Contraception Coverage Case
headline.print_headline: Federal Appeals Court Rules Against Nuns in Contraception Coverage Case

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court in Denver on Tuesday ruled that an order of Roman Catholic nuns must comply with President Barack Obama's healthcare law requiring employers to provide insurance that covers contraception.
